thread.title: The secret to finding love online
thread.title_full: The secret to finding love online

title: The secret to finding love online
text:
If you’re looking for love online, don’t forget to keep it real Zoe Krupka news.com.au If you’re looking for love online, don’t forget to keep it real Zoe Krupka news.com.au Trying your luck at online dating? Don’t pretend to be someone you’re not. 
TAKE a good look at your friend. In person, face to face. Then take a look at your friend on Twitter, Facebook or Instagram. Do the two pictures match up? 
If they’re actually human, chances are that your pal’s online profile is different in some key ways to their in person real self. Given two minutes warning of someone coming over, most of us will clear our crap out of the lounge room. We want to make a decent impression. Pretend we’re always tidy. 
And online, the opportunities for a little profile tidying are endless. This is not news to anyone who hasn’t been living under a rock since the 90s. The problem is, if you’re trying to find love, all the airbrushing of your real, messy self might help you find people who are happy to visit, but it’s not going to help you find someone who wants to stay the distance. If you want to find real love online, it’s time to stop treating yourself like an AirBnb. Tinder is one of the most popular online dating apps for smartphones. 
Online dating has a very long and chequered history. As far back as the 60s and 70s, psychologists and matchmaking gurus were trying to build programs to help singles find their perfect match. They had two main ideas that haven’t changed despite the fact that we’ve gone from computers the size of office buildings to smartphones smaller than a cronut: offer a pool of people as big as possible and look for compatibility. 
The problem for most of us, is that we’re so concerned with appealing to as wide a group of people as possible, that we often miss out on the compatibility part, and this may mean we end up going on more dates that go nowhere . While we’re busy cropping our photos, editing our real interests and softening our hard edges to attract as many potential mates as possible, we’re making the age old mistake of keeping our real selves in the closet, thinking that love can only come if someone doesn’t really know who we are. 
This is frustrating for the geeks with the algorhythms , because of course they need the real stuff to help you find the real thing. If you’re not brave enough or self-aware enough to describe yourself accurately, no one who might be really interested will ever be able to find you. Other Stories
